p: There are very few studies investigating the impact on phages of molecules other than those listed so far. Pioneering work in the late 1950 s demonstrated how hydroquinone and pyrogallol (both derivatives of phenol but not polyphenols) reduced the infectivity of T coliphages [ 148]. Psoralens belong to the family of furocoumarins, photoactive polyphenols that can induce DNA damage. They are particularly abundant in the peel of limes [ 149]. Accordingly, a six-hour exposure with lime juice in vitro reduced the infectivity of MS2 by 1.3 log 10 even in the absence of photoactivation [ 107].
